text: CLOSE ON: A "Have A Nice Day" HAPPY FACE PIN. STEAM rises past the pin. We hear a KETTLE BOILING. We PULL BACK and find that the pin adorns the lapel of a worn by EDWARD BLAKE, 63, but amazingly not far from his physical prime--body chiseled, built like a truck. Handso too, save the LONG SCAR running down the side of his face Blake removes the kettle from the stove. He scoops some A tea leaves from a can, dumps them in a cup .

The apartment is expensive but not quite luxurious. Terri New York view from the window. Blake lives well, if alone sits on the couch with his cup of, tea, puts his feet up. the remote, turns the big screen TV on. The news:

--addressing the United Nations today, the President expressed his concern over the increasingly intense territorial disputes in both Asia and the Middle East. CUT TO: The PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES--

The sound of a bullet at one end of the world echoes across the ocean to the other end. Armed conflict is not self contained in its respective region--the consequences reverberate through every nation across the world and therefore must be avoided at all costs. CUT BACK TO: The Anchorwoman--

While the President's position was clear, he did not comment on whether or not he would order Dr. Manhattan into action should the situation continue to escalate. CUT TO: Stock footage of DR. MANHATTAN--a man, at least h appears to be, who has glowing blue skin. The stock foota shows Dr. Manhattan flying through the air as a MISSILE h straight for him. (CONTINUED)

With a wave of his hand, Dr. Manhattan stops the missile its flight--frozen in mid-air--inches from his face. With another wave, Dr. Manhattan DETONATES the missile. D Manhattan disappears in the EXPLOSION . but once the smoke clears, we see he's still there. Unscathed-- --Blake snorts at the stock footage, changes the channel- CRASH!--The FRONT DOOR EXPLODES, splintered by a KICK; Bl jumps up, immediately at the ready-- --when we see the INTRUDER'S FEET entering. Slowly. Blake sees the Intruder's face, though we never do--we only see that he's dressed in ALL BLACK, including GLOVES and a KN HAT. A look of recognition comes over Blake.

Just a matter of time, I suppose. With sudden, blinding speed, Blake WHIPS the SAUCER from under his cup, sending it FLYING like a saw-blade. The Intruder BATS IT out of the air with even quicker reflexe but the act buys Blake time to pull a PISTOL with a SILEN from a hollowed out STEREO SPEAKER. He's a pro . but so is our Intruder. Before Blake can get a shot off, the Intruder is already upon him, SNATCHING the gun of Blake's hand-- --Blake PUNCHES the Intruder in the chest plate--the Intr drops the gun. Blake fights. Not like an old man, but lik the trained killer he is. But the Intruder is much, much faster. Younger. Deadlier. He SMASHES Blake with an elbow the head. Blake falls. BLOOD blurs his vision. The Intruder picks B up off the ground. Brings him to the window with the grea New York view. Thirty stories up. Blake looks the Intrude the eye . and starts laughing. Hysterical.

I always thought I knew the punchline. But I guess the joke's on me now. He laughs. The INTRUDER seems to regard Blake a moment-- --then, with incredible strength, he LIFTS BLAKE OVER HIS HEAD AND THROWS BLAKE THROUGH THE WINDOW. Blake never mak sound as he plummets to the sidewalk. 3.

CLOSE ON: Blake's dead body. His eyes are wide open, not fear, but in resignation. As BLOOD starts to POOL behind head, we move to the happy face pin Blake wore, now on th sidewalk by his neck. We slowly ZOOM IN on the pin as blo DRIPS on it . when the pin is WASHED AWAY.
A SHOPKEEPER has his HOSE out, spraying off the blood fro the sidewalk. Blake's body is gone, a CHALK OUTLINE in it place. A COP comes running up to the Shopkeeper.
Hey! This is still a goddamn crime scene!

It's been over four hours, I got a business to run-- As they argue, we're back following the happy face pin, a the water carries it to a DRAIN-- --when someone picks the pin up. We're in this person's P as he studies the pin for a moment before pocketing it. We never see his face. We move from his POV-- --to across the street, arriving at a NEWS STAND. People the news stand stare at. the crime scene. At the cop stil arguing with the shopkeeper, the patrol cars, the yellow tape. At the MEDICAL EXAMINER zipping up Blake's BODY BAG Other people at the news stand ignore the scene and perus the magazines and periodicals, most of which have inflammatory headlines regarding the tense atmosphere currently in the world--a Newsweek headline reads "War?", New York Times: "China Moves Battleships near Taiwanese Waters," The New York Post, over a PHOTO of the President with Dr. Manhattan: "What Me Worry?" The NEWS VENDOR notices a MAN frowning at the papers.
(re: headlines) Depressing ain't it?
But good for business, right? (CONTINUED)
Yeah. Irony's a bitch. The man pays for a newspaper when A HOMELESS MAN taps the News Vendor on the shoulder.
The current issue of The New Frontiersman, where is it?
It's late this month.
When will it be here?

I dunno, pal, like I said, it's late-- We MOVE BACK ACROSS THE STREET, to Blake's apartment building, then MOVE UP the building, to the broken glass window Blake was thrown out of. We MOVE INTO THE WINDOW--
--inside the apartment, where DET. GALLAGHER (older, jade and DET. FINE (street worn, but not quite cynical yet) wa through the crime scene. Fine studies the broken window.

Edward Blake--63 years old, six-two, 225. A solid 225, guy was built like a linebacker. This is plate glass too, you'd have to step on the gas just to put a crack in this. Had to be a two man job. At least. You check the bedroom?
Drawers were open, tossed through. Mattress flipped.
Robbery?
Or made to look like one. (tosses Fine an ID) Found that in the bedroom. Det. Fine studies it. It's Blake's UNITED NATIONS ID. It reads "Special Advisor, United States." (CONTINUED)
You see this? He picks up a PHOTO from the floor, hands it to Fine.
Shaking hands with the President.
You're saying this guy was a spook? You think this might be a political murder?
I think that this is way bigger than the both of us. He leaves Det. Fine to ponder this.

Outside Blake's apartment building. It's later now, the n stand is closed, businesses closed, people gone. We move into someone's POV. The person stares up at the broken window of Blake's apartment, now covered with PLAS SHEETING.

Rorschach's Journal, October 12th. Earlier today I came across what appeared to be a suicide. It was later learned to be a homicide. Someone's time was up. Still in POV, we see the person pull something from his pocket--the happy face pin. We realize that this was the person whose POV we were in earlier.

I discovered a clue. Something I recognized. And suddenly, unexpectedly . I heard my own clock ticking. We move out of the POV and see our guy for the first time RORSCHACH (roar-shock)--a masked vigilante who wears a tr coat, fedora, and a silver-white MASK with oily BLACK SPO moving about, creating shifting, doubled PATTERNS like a Rorschach test. Scary looking. Rorschach draws a hydraulic GRAPPLING GUN from his coat, FIRES the HOOK AND CABLE THIRTY STORIES UP where it latch itself through Blake's broken window. Pressing RETRACT, Rorschach FLIES UP THE WALL to the 30th floor. 6.

With a grunt, Rorschach pulls himself past the plastic sheeting, through the window, and into Blake's apartment. investigates, silent. He sees the same things that the co saw . . but he notices the speakers by the TV. Notices on of the speaker covers is ever so slightly askew. Rorschach pulls the speaker cover off and discovers that speaker was hollow. (The Intruder clearly took Blake's gu and put the cover back on when he left. Why?)

Blake's clothing hangs in military rows. Rorschach runs h fingers along the wall-seams. He pauses, presses on the hanger BAR, which SLIDES BACK to reveal a RED BUTTON. Pressing it, the BACK WALL of the closet SLIDES OPEN, revealing a SECRET COMPARTMENT. On the wall is an old FRA PHOTO of EIGHT PEOPLE IN COSTUMES, from the 60s. Included this photo is a young Edward Blake--Blake wasn't a spook- was a superhero. WEAPONS of all kinds adorn the walls in here. TEAR-GAS, GRENADES, RIFLES, PISTOLS--if it can kill you Blake's got But that's not what draws Rorschach's attention. Hanging on the back wall, dead center, is a more current COSTUME. Black leather armor, gloves, boots. Hanging over all like a vacant, grinning face--a black leather MASK. Rorschach stares. Framed nearby is the FRONT PAGE OF THE BOSTON GLOBE. The headline reads "The Comedian Gets Last Laugh On Moloch." Underneath is a photo of Blake dressed the costume Rorschach was staring at--Blake was a superhe called the Comedian. In the photo, Blake holds a supervil named MOLOCH prisoner. (We'll meet Moloch later.) On the same page is a smaller photo of a group of superheroes. Rorschach is in the photo, as is Dr. Manhatt as is the Comedian. (As are DAN DREIBERG, ADRIAN VEIDT, a LAURIE JUPITER, all of whom we'll be meeting soon). The caption below reads: "The New Watchmen." Suddenly, Rorschach hears the front door open. He quickly closes the secret hatch.
Two uniformed COPS stand in the doorway. (CONTINUED)
You sure it wasn't the wind?
Nah, I definitely heard something.

I tell ya, I'd rather do traffic duty than be posted at a crime scene all night. Watch the door. Cop 1 pulls his gun, going through the motions rather tha being concerned. He then enters the bedroom. Cop 2 stands guard, nervous From the bedroom:

Clear! I'm checking the other rooms. Cop 2 relaxes a bit, turns-- --and comes face to "face" with Rorschach, standing inche away. The Cop's face goes slack with childish terror. He to yell but Rorschach raises two fingers, "Shhh"-- The fingers JAB INTO THE COP'S WINDPIPE. The cop HISSES a falls silently as Rorschach brushes past him like a whisp
See, the Comedian thought he had it all worked out.
CLOSE ON: A FRAMED PHOTO of the first Watchmen--identical the old one in Blake's closet. Holding the photo is HOLLI MASON. He puts the photo down, but we don't see his face

He was young and arrogant, but what he lacked in experience, he made up for in . tenacity. As he speaks, we PAN ACROSS various FRAMED MEMORABILIA: T first is a NEWSPAPER CLIPPING dated 1958: MYSTERIOUS MASK MAN CLEANS UP WHARFS--the caption underneath reads "Hero Calls Himself The Nite Owl."
Guess I was that way too, when I started. I'll never know what possessed me to put that mask on the first time. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

It started with the villains, y'know, people forget that. Pirate outfits, ghosts. Gangs that thought it was funny to dress up and pull heists, crap like that. PAN ACROSS: Another FRAMED CLIPPING, dated 1962: NITE OWL FORMS WATCHMEN--COSTUMED HEROES COMBINING FORCES! "'We're going to clean up this town!' Says costumed crusader."

So a few cops, we decide it might be funny to mask up too. Be anonymous. Take these guys on at the street level, right? Then the media got wind, ran with it, turned it into a whole different beast. PAN ACROSS: A GOLD STATUE of NITE OWL in his Sixties-era costume. The plaque below reads: IN GRATITUDE, 1969. Anot clipping: "Hero Retires, Reveals Identity In Tell All Boo Finally, we come to HOLLIS MASON (aka Nite Owl), 70s, tho his eyes sparkle with strength and his face still shows t edges of a born hero. The TV is on in the background.
Superheroes, Supervillians--you know who I ran into the other day at the market? The Screaming Skull. We chatted for a while. Turns out he's a born again.

No way. We see who Hollis is speaking to--DAN DREIBERG (the secon Nite Owl), late 30's, handsome, though he's let himself g the past few years--his edges have gone soft. He was in t photo of the new Watchmen in Blake's apartment.
All the nuts that started popping up, I'll tell ya. Who was that midget you and your partner chased down years ago? What'd he call himself?
The Big Figure.
Big Figure. A midget bad guy. Guess it doesn't get lower than that, does it? Hollis laughs at his own joke; Dan chuckles, polite. (CONTINUED)
(glances at his watch) Wow, it's really late. Dan stands, finishes his beer. Hollis sees him to the doo
Well, even though I spent my time catching real bad guys, you were still a better Nite Owl than I ever was.
That's bullshit, Hollis, and you know it. They hug.
With all this talk of war, all that's going on in the world, it's a shame the government forced all you guys out. Before Dan can answer he notices a breaking news report o the TV:

This just in--masked vigilante Rorschach has assaulted a New York City police officer who was guarding a crime scene in the early morning hours. Rorschach is on the FBIs ten most wanted list for violation of the Keene Act, which banned masked heroes ten years ago. Dan and Hollis watch as an image of Rorschach flashes on screen.
Well, forced all of you guys out except one. (BEAT)
Next week? Dan nods, then leaves.
Dan descends the stairs. He pulls up his collar against t cold and walks down an alley. A SIGN below Hollis' apartm reads: "MASON AUTO REPAIRS--Obsolete models a specialty!" 10.
Dan rides the subway, lost in thought, when a group of GA MEMBERS, wearing yellow and black BANDANAS brush past him ONE stops. Dan's leg is out, a couple inches too far.
Move your leg.
What?
I said move, dick. Dan finally realizes what he's talking about. Dan meets h eyes, for just a moment and draws back his leg. The Gang Members snicker at Dan as they pass.

Dan walks down the empty street to his TOWNHOUSE, digging his keys. Then he stops, suddenly alert. His front door hangs slightly OPEN--the LOCK'S been SMASH There's a LIGHT on inside. Cautious, Dan enters the house
Dan quietly approaches the light coming from his kitchen. hears odd, metal scraping SOUNDS.
Dan enters the kitchen, stunned to find--
Rorschach. Rorschach sits at the table, mask half up, eating a cold OF BEANS.
Hello Daniel. I helped myself to some beans. You don't mind?
No, of course not. You uh, want me to heat some up for you?
No need. (CONTINUED)
Rorschach finishes the can of beans, stands, pulls his ma back down. There's a strong familiarity between the two b at the same time, Dan is wary.
You were on the news. They say you attacked a cop.
Minor wound. Won't need hospitalization.
Other than that . How have you been keeping?
Out of prison. So far. Look at this. He tosses Blake's happy face pin onto the table. Dan pick up, runs his fingers over the RED-BROWN SPLOTCH.
This little stain, is that bean juice or--
Human bean juice. It belonged to the Comedian. He's dead.
The Comedian? Nervous now, Dan glances out the window. DAN (cont'd) Let's talk downstairs.

Rorschach follows Dan to a CLOSET, at the end of the hall Dan opens the closet, revealing an old BOOKSHELF. With so difficulty, Dan PULLS OPEN the HINGED BOOKSHELF with a RU CREAK. STEEL STAIRS lead down into the dark.

The two men descend into Dan's WORKSHOP--the dusty remnan of a hero's LAB; Old computers and an OWL-COSTUME, hangin a locker. No-one has been down here for years. In the cen of the space, an OVAL VEHICLE the size of a subway car is covered by a dusty TARP--the Owl-Ship.
How did it happen? (CONTINUED)
Murder. Someone threw him out a window.
Maybe it was a burglary. The killer might not have known who Blake was.
An ordinary burglar? Kill the Comedian? Ridiculous.
You're right. I heard he was working for the government. Maybe it was a political killing.
Maybe. Or maybe someone's decided to kill off costumed heroes.
You don't think that's . a little paranoid?
Is that what they're saying about me now? That I'm paranoid?

I-'m just saying the Comedian made a lot of enemies over the years, even amongst his friends, if he had any. The man wasn't exactly endearing. Just because something happened to him doesn't mean it involves us.
One of our own has been murdered. I thought you might be interested. An attack on one is an attack on all of us, right? Dan hesitates.
I'm out, Rorschach. I've been out, we've all been out. Except you. You know that.
Yes. I know that. Anyways, I thought I'd let you know. Just in case. (CONTINUED)
Yeah, thanks. You can take the tunnel out to the warehouse on Fleet street-- Rorschach turns to walk off down a long, dark TUNNEL.
I remember. Used to come here a lot. Back when we were partners.
Yeah. Those were good times, Rorschach. Great times. (more to himself) What ever happened to them?
You quit. Rorschach disappears into the SUBWAY TUNNEL, leaving Dan reminisce alone. Dan glances at his old costume hanging.
The kind of room you rent by the hour. Or the minute even cheap looking HOOKER enters with an ARMY OFFICER, gigglin She playfully pushes the Officer onto the bed.
So tell me what you wanna do. Sir.

Seeing that I don't have to be back to base till Friday--everything. He puts a stack of BILLS on the dresser. Then takes his UNIFORM off like he can't wait. The Hooker gets on top of --when the DOOR FLIES OFF THE HINGES. Rorschach steps in, yanks the Hooker off-- --the officer gets to his feet, throws a punch, which Rorschach dodges. Rorschach GRABS the guy's arm, then KIC the Officer on the side of his KNEE, tearing the joint to shreds. The Officer cries out in pain, falls to the floor Rorschach nails him in the head with a BLACK JACK, knocki him out. The Hooker screams. Rorschach grabs her by the hair and S her face into the wall.
Quiet, whore. (CONTINUED)
Nose broken and bleeding, the Hooker quiets to a whimper. Rorschach takes the officer's uniform and ID. Then leaves
A mammoth, shining skyscraper. At the 50th-floor there is HUGE V-SHAPED HOLE where WATER FALLS.
A mammoth lobby. The decor is Egyptian and marble. Dan approaches a beautiful ASSISTANT behind an imposing desk.
I'm here to see Adrian Veidt.
Do you have an appointment?
No, uh, just tell him Dan Dreiberg is here to see him.
I'm sorry, Mr. Veidt doesn't see anyone without an appointment.
I understand, but if you would just tell Adrian that Dan Dreiberg is here, I'm an old friend.
Well, Mr. Veidt is very busy at the

Just tell him I'm here. I assure you he'll see me. Dan glares at her. She glares right back. A game of chick She reluctantly gets up, goes inside the office. Once she's gone, Dan's glare disappears, replaced by nervousness. Because he's not sure if Adrian will see him it's been a long time. He glances at the SECURITY GUARDS eyeing him. Finally, the Assistant returns.
Go on in, Mr. Dreiberg. 15.

Dan enters the enormous office--there are three TV feeds PROJECTED onto the walls, architectural models of real es developments, poster size ad campaigns for "Nostalgia" perfume--all reflecting the financial empire of Veidt Enterprises owned by-- --ADRIAN VEIDT, late 30s, movie star looks, is at the far of the office, SPRINTING on a treadmill as journalist DOU ROTH holds a tape recorder to him. Adrian sees Dan approaching, smiles wide. He holds up a finger, telling D to hold on a sec. Dan nods, takes a seat on the couch. Pi up a Fortune magazine with Adrian on the cover.
Mr. Veidt, would you acknowledge that you are considered the world's smartest man?
(LAUGHS)

I think it's better to be the world's most modest man. You should ignore my PR people, they tend to be a little too enthusiastic. Though Adrian seems to be sprinting at top speed, he hard seems out of breath as he answers questions.

If we could move off the subject of business for a moment, I'm curious whether the world's smartest man thinks we're headed for our next World War. Adrian stops the treadmill, towels off as he heads to Dan

Predicting stock prices isn't the same as predicting world events. I hope there isn't a war, or even a skirmish for that matter. Because Veidt Enterprises has some exciting plans, plans that will, pardon the cliche, truly make this world a better place. My team of engineers and scientists have been working with Dr. Manhattan himself on synthesizing a new, cheap form of energy which will eliminate the worlds reliance on fossil fuels with no toxic emissions. This energy could power cars, aircrafts, stadiums--there are no limitations-- (reaching Dan) (MORE) (CONTINUED)
--but I talk too much. Will you mind pausing the interview a moment, Doug? A good friend of mine is here. Doug Roth leaves. Adrian hugs Dan, despite the sweat.
You look good, Adrian.
Dan--it's been far too long.
Dan and Adrian sit, talking over coffee. Dan examines an ACTION-FIGURE of Adrian as OZYMANDIAS (his superhero alia
Rorschach. He paid me a visit too.
He did? Must've been tough to get past your security, even for him. I thought your assistant was going to take me out.
(LAUGHS)
Sara can be tough. Is that why you came to see me? You're worried about this mask killer theory Rorschach's conjured up?
You're the world's smartest man, Adrian. You tell me.

Rorschach's a sociopath suffering through nostalgia. I revealed my identity to the public as soon as the Keene Act was passed. If an old enemy wanted me dead it would have been done already. Adrian notices the news on one of his TV projectors. Something about Pakistan putting troops along the Indian border. Adrian turns up the volume, looking grim.
No, there are other things in the world I'm far more concerned about. ON THE WALL: The TV projector shows an image of TWO PAKIS SOLDIERS on patrol. 17.
We're now actually with the two Soldiers on patrol. One o the Soldiers takes out a pair of binoculars, looking into mountains. (They speak in Baluchi)
We should attack the Indian bastards. I don't understand-- CUT TO: POV--a SNIPER SCOPE, locked in on the Pakistani soldier.
--why I can't just pull this trigger. We see two Indian Soldiers, hidden in the mountains, one his sniper rifle aimed. (They speak in Hindi)
Because then a battle begins. Then a war. And then the Americans will send--

(in Mandarin) --their blue abomination to intervene. And we don't want that. At the same time, we can't assume to know what's on the minds of our enemies. We're in Chinese waters, off the coast of Taiwan. The CHI CAPTAIN and his First Mate look out at the water. TAIWANE GUNBOATS can be seen in the distance.
We're in the control room as an ISRAELI OFFICER and his m younger AIDE watch SATELLITE IMAGES on the giant screen. Images of potential targets. (They speak in Hebrew)
Is Dr. Manhattan even real?
Why don't you ask the Vietnamese. Or the Iraqis? Dr. Manhattan is real. Thank god for that. 18.

A SIGN posted on a RAZOR-WIRE FENCE reads: ROCKEFELLER MILITARY RESEARCH CENTER. An M16-toting GUARD stands at t gate. We move into Rorschach's POV as he approaches the gate. T guard has no reaction to Rorschach-- --because Rorschach is in disguise, wearing the Army Officer's uniform he stole. Rorschach presents his ID. Th Guard waves him through.
Rorschach ditches the uniform in the trash and puts his m on. He quietly enters--
--a huge room, which contains technologically advanced MILITARY DEVICES. Distorted in sections of GLASS, we see REFLECTION of a HUGE MAN, GLOWING BRIGHT BLUE--

Good evening, Rorschach. --and we see DR. MANHATTAN (formerly Jon Osterman) for th very first time. He is SIXTY FEET TALL, BLUE LIGHT ripple from his skin, emanating pure power--he is God on earth. works on a reactor--telekinetically moving parts in the a not even looking at Rorschach. It's as if Dr. Manhattan already knew he was coming.
Dr. Manhattan. Dr. Manhattan continues about his business when his girlfriend, LAURIE JUPITER, 30, very much in her prime, enters from the other end.
Jon, did you say some--Rorschach: What are you doing here? You're a wanted man.
Nice to see you too, Silk Spectre.
Don't call me that. My mother made me take that name. I always hated it. (CONTINUED)
Sorry, Miss Jupiter. I thought I should tell you the bad news--the Comedian has been murdered.

Yes, since he and I are the only two extranormal operatives currently employed by the government, I was informed. The CIA suspects one of the radical Islamic groups. Dr. Manhattan shrinks from sixty to six feet in size. He speaks in a cold, even, matter of fact manner.
I have my own theories. But neither of you seem too concerned.
A live human body and a dead human body have the same number of particles. Structurally there's no difference.
Well, I might not be able to count molecules, but either way, Blake was a bastard. You know he tried to rape my mother?
Sounds like you may have had a score to settle. You or your mother.
What? Are you accusing--
Rorschach, please don't upset Laurie. I
He pauses as if he hears something.
Excuse me for a moment. Suddenly he disappears.
A group of suspicious looking MIDDLE EASTERN MEN watch as CONTAINER is being loaded onto a TRUCK-- (CONTINUED)
--when suddenly Dr. Manhattan materializes in a blue flas floating in mid-air. The Middle Eastern Men shield their from the light, then realize in awe and fear

(in Arabic) It's him He's, he's real. Allah help us, he's real! The men run for it but it's useless--Dr. Manhattan shoots BEAMS OF ENERGY at them, freezing all the men in mid moti --when PORT SECURITY pulls up. They get out of their jeep in awe of Dr. Manhattan, still floating in mid-air.

These men were transporting a shipment of enriched uranium-- With a gesture, the container floats off the truck and separates into pieces . . revealing the URANIUM inside. Suddenly the uranium changes--
I've safely transformed the uranium into sand. I trust you can take things from here. And just like that he disappears--
--and is back in the lab without missing a beat.
--I'm not here to judge the moral discrepancies of a man who died in service of his country.
You call rape a moral discrepancy?!
Rorschach--you're upsetting Laurie. I think you ought to go.
I came here to warn you both, just like I warned Adrian and Dan. I believe someone may be targeting masked heroes--
I said you ought to go. (CONTINUED)
It took a lot of effort to get in here. I'm not leaving before I've-- With a look, Dr. Manhattan makes Rorschach disappear.
Rorschach materializes down the road from the base.
--had my say Rorschach realizes what just happened. Checks himself, hi surroundings. Reorients himself. With nothing else he can he heads down the road.
Dr. Manhattan resumes his work. He looks distracted.
He's gone. Are you okay now?
(studies Dr. Manhattan) Are you okay, Jon? Dr. Manhattan pauses for a moment, thoughtful.
I'm having trouble with my vision. I can't see clearly what lies ahead. There's some static interference.
Interference? Caused by what?
I'm uncertain. A power surge of great magnitude? Perhaps a nuclear detonation.
More war talk. I can't deal with this. I don't want to think about the future right now.
There's no such thing as the "future." I've explained to you on many occasions-- (CONTINUED)
--that time is simultaneous. There's no past to travel back to, no future to travel forward to, everything happens all at once, our actions affect the course of time instantly, yes I know. (BEAT)
I'm sorry, it's just a little unnerving to be with someone who can see the future, or whatever you call it.

I understand your frustration, Laurie. The human mind for some reason is only capable of viewing time frame by frame. Perhaps you'd find it more comforting if you could perceive time as I do Dr. Manhattan touches her head--

Laurie's childhood home. We're in Laurie's POV, as a litt girl. There's arguing downstairs. Laurie goes down to investigate. She comes upon the kitchen door, ajar. She can see her PARENTS inside, arguing--
Jon, stop!
Back in the present, Laurie pulls away from Dr. Manhattan touch. That memory seems to be painful for her.
I didn't mean to upset you.
I know. I think I've been cooped up on this base for too long. Rorschach mentioned Dan Dreiberg--we haven't seen him in years. Maybe we can give him a call, see if he's available for dinner tonight.
You go ahead, Laurie. I want to further investigate this interference with my vision. I find it troubling. 23.
Laurie, dressed up and looking gorgeous, heads out when s stopped by a SECRET SERVICE AGENT FORBES.
Going somewhere, Miss Jupiter?
Out.
I'll have a car brought around in a few minutes.
No, thank you. I called a cab already-- it's waiting for me outside. She tries to walk past but Agent Forbes steps in front of her.
You look quite nice. Who are you meeting?
An old friend of mine. And of Dr. Manhattan's. Now step out of my way.
Please keep in mind, Ms. Jupiter, that your boyfriend is this country's most valuable asset. You need to keep him happy. And on our side. Laurie glares at him.
Yes, sir. She brushes past him as she leaves.
We move down the beautifully lit New York city skyline, passing the Brooklyn Bridge . the Statue of Liberty and the in Towers of the World Trade Center? We hear the LAUGHTER-- 24.
--of Dan and Laurie as they finish up their meal at this trendy restaurant.
You remember that crazy guy, what did he call himself . Captain Carnage! Pretended to be a supervillian just so he could get beat up all the time?
Yeah, he tried that with me once. I just walked away but he starts following me down the street in broad daylight yelling, "punish me! punish me!"
(LAUGHS)
Whatever happened to him?
Uh, well, he pulled that on Rorschach and Rorschach dropped him down an elevator shaft. They look at each other, serious, then explode in laughte

Sorry, sorry, that's not funny. I can't remember the last time I laughed like this. It feels good. Dan looks at her as she finishes her coffee. We can see h smitten with her and that he probably has been for years. Laurie seems oblivious.
It's great seeing you again, Laurie.
Yeah, this was fun. The WAITER arrives with the check; Laurie grabs it.
You sure I can't get that?
Let me put my expense account to use. You can thank Uncle Sam. (CONTINUED)
Laurie nods out the window. Dan turns and sees a GOVERNME SEDAN parked outside.
They've been watching the whole time?
Just making sure I'm not doing anything that might upset the country's most powerful weapon.
How is Jon, by the way?

I really don't know. It's been harder and harder to tell over the years. It's like his emotions are slowly eroding. To be honest, I can't tell if he even cares about me anymore. They're quiet a moment. Laurie glances at her watch.
I should get back.
Dan and Laurie step outside.
Y1 know, when I think back, why did we do it? Why did we dress up like that? I think the Keene Act was the best thing to ever happen to us.
You're probably right.
I mean, you remember my costume? All that tight spandex? That was awful.
Uh, yeah. Awful.
And to think my own mother pushed me into that spandex. Pushed me into the whole costume thing in the first place. Wanted her little girl to be just like mommy and fight bad guys. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
(BEAT)
Well, I guess my ride is here. She gives Dan a hug.
We'll do this again.
Yeah. I'd really like that. Laurie crosses the street and gets into the sedan. As Dan watches the car drive off, TWO KIDS nearly bump into him, running around playing. The Kids make flying noises.
I'm Dr. Manhattan, saving the Twin Towers!
No, I wanna be Dr. Manhattan!
You can take turns, okay? Dan watches the Kids for a moment, then walks away. The T Towers looming behind him.
Days later. A few mourners gather in the rain for Edward Blake aka The Comedian's funeral. Mostly government types Dan, Adrian and Dr. Manhattan line the edge of an open gr
Laurie MATERIALIZES in the hallway of her mother's condo California. She immediately runs to the bathroom.
Bright California sunshine gleams over this upscale condo facility. Laurie's mother, SALLY, 60s but looks in her 40 reclines by the POOL. She hears someone VOMITING in her condo.
Laurie? Is that you?
Sally steps through the sliding glass doors as we hear th toilet FLUSHING. Laurie wobbles out of the bathroom. (CONTINUED)
I'd figure you'd be used to traveling that way by now.
Well, I'm not. I hate it when Jon teleports me.
Margarita?

No. Sally pours herself a margarita from a pitcher on the counter. We see photos, remnants of Sally from her crimefighting days around the condo. Under the pitcher of margaritas is a days old LA Times with the headline: "Dr. Manhattan Intercepts Terrorists At Port."
It's Eddie Blake's funeral today, isn't it? Laurie nods. (From here on, intercut between Blake's fune and Sally's condo) FUNERAL: Blake's coffin is removed from the hearse.
Finally got his punchline, I guess. Poor Eddie.
Poor Eddie? How can you say that? After what he--
Laurie, you're still young. You don't understand how things change as time goes by. FUNERAL: Blake's coffin is carried past Adrian, Dan and D Manhattan.

Another lesson on time passing. Y'know, you and Jon should get together and write a book on the subject. Sally reaches into a drawer and pulls out the old photo o the Watchmen, the same one with Blake and Hollis Mason in (CONTINUED)
That leaves just two of the old team left. Me and Hollis Mason. She stops at Blake in the photo, regarding him.
Eddie was the Comedian. He always thought he'd get the last laugh. As the PRIEST speaks, we move down the row of mourners, stopping at Dr. Manhattan looking thoughtfully into Blake
MATCH CUT TO: Dr. Manhattan. In the night sky, a BURST of FIREWORKS. Outside, a CROWD of Vietnamese people CHEER.
Fireworks. A young Blake sits in a derelict Saigon bar, mean drunk. face is devoid of his trademark scar.
You'd think this country'd had enough goddamn fireworks. If we'd've lost this war, I think it might have driven us crazy, y'know? As a country. But we didn't. Thanks to you.
You sound bitter.
Me? I think it's hilarious.
Mr. Eddie? They both turn. A pretty VIETNAMESE GIRL stands in the do She's pregnant, just starting to show.
Fantastic. Just what I need.
The war is over now. We must talk. (touching her abdomen) About this. (CONTINUED)
Blake SLAMS his glass down. He glares at her, drunk and dangerous.
There's nothing to talk about cuz I'm leaving. I'm gonna forget you and your horrible, sweaty little country. He turns away. Her eyes blaze with betrayal and hatred.
No. You will remember. You will remember me and my country forever. She SMASHES a bottle. Blake turns just as the broken SHAR SLASH HIS FACE, slicing him his jagged scar
You bitch! My face! He PUSHES HER into the bar and DRAWS HIS PISTOL--
Blake . don't. BLAM! Blake shoots her; the Girl SLAMS against the far wa She drops, dead.
Blake. She was pregnant. You gunned her down. Blake turns on him, spitting fury.

That's right! And you know what? You watched me! You could've changed the gun into steam or the bullets into mercury or the bottle into snowflakes, but you didn't, did you? You're drifting outta touch, Doc--I've seen it. Don't tell me the war got to you. Blake walks off shouting "Medic!" Dr. Manhattan turns to girl's body and regards it, curious. MATCH CUT TO:
Dr. Manhattan looking down at Blake's grave. We move down

This is all bullshit. Dan, fit and trim in full Nite Owl regalia, attends the meeting of the "new" Watchmen. Rorschach is there, as is teenage Laurie, dressed in her tight spandex costume. Dr. Manhattan, his age unchanged, stands with his girlfriend JANEY SLATER, though he casts occasional glances at young Laurie . who definitely glances back. Dan also pays Laurie attention, but she is oblivious. A younger Adrian, dressed as Oxymandias, leads the meetin
What are you saying, Comedian? Blake, now in his forties, smokes a CIGAR, feet on the ta a FLASK in hand. The PAPER in his hand reads: "Arab Leade Call Dr. Manhattan: 'America's Weapon of Satan."'
What I'm saying is this whole bringing back the Watchmen thing is bullshit. It didn't work twenty years ago, and it ain't gonna work just because you want to keep on playing Cowboys and Indians.
Maybe we should agree on no drinking at meetings. Look, Rorschach and I have made real headway on the gang problem by pooling our efforts. Rorschach's voice is quiet, not yet its tortured rasp.
That's true. But something like this seems too big. Too bureaucratic.
Bureaucracies can be effective with the right leadership--
And that would be you, right Veidt? I mean you're the "smartest guy in the world," right?
It doesn't take a genius to see that the world has problems. (CONTINUED)
But it takes a roomful of morons to think they're small enough for you guys to handle. You people are a joke. You hear Moloch's back in town and get your panties in a bunch. You think that matters?
Of course it does. Justice matters.

Justice. Hilarious. There's no such thing as justice. He stands, moving to Adrian's DISPLAY which outlines the Watchmen's agenda: GANGS, RACKETEERING, DRUGS. Blake flic his ZIPPO and the display GOES UP IN FLAMES.
My display .

Justice doesn't matter, alright? Because twenty years from now we're all gonna be dust. Mankind's been trying to kill each other off since the beginning of time and now we finally got the power to finish the job. Ain't nothin' gonna matter when the nukes start flying, and I promise you they will. Then Ozymandias here is gonna be the smartest man on the cinder. He sneers and walks out. Silence. Uncomfortable in the wa of truth, the others pack up to go, muttering apologies t Adrian, but Adrian ignores them, staring at the flames flickering across his face. He seems more thoughtful than upset. MATCH CUT TO:
Adrian, moving down to Dan as we FADE TO:

A NEWSPAPER BOX. The headlines: "Cops Say: 'Let Them Do I "Senator Keene Proposes Emergency Bill Banning Vigilantis PAN UP TO REVEAL: The streets JAMMED with ANGRY PROTESTOR waving signs decrying vigilantes. ANGLE ON: AN OVAL AIRSHIP--the OWL SHIP--its forward wind sculpted like the eyes of a great owl. (CONTINUED)
Dan, in costume, pilots the ship. The Comedian stands out the ship, in one of the "owl eyes," wielding a MACHINE GU
(over loudspeakers)

head_text.subj: EVERYONE, PLEASE CLEAR THE STREETS. WE
ARE TRYING TO RETAIN ORDER UNTIL THE

text: Crawl back in yer holes before you get hurt! I got rubber bullets!
We want regular cops! No more vigilantes!
My son is a cop, asshole! The Comedian gets HIT IN THE HEAD by a flying SODA CAN.
Okay, that's how you wanna do it?! Smiling grimly, he FIRES TEAR GAS CANNISTERS INTO THE CRO
Oh God. (over speakers)

head_text.subj: LOOK, I'M SORRY. YOU'VE LEFT US NO

text: The Comedian DIVES into the crowd, knocking random people aside with his rifle butt, then starts firing rubber bull into the crowd. The protestors scatter and retreat. Dan l the Owl Ship, exits wearing a GAS MASK, hands one to Blak
Comedian, this is a nightmare! The whole city is erupting!
Hah! You seen this? The smoke clears enough for Dan to see a message SPRAY- PAINTED on a brick wall: "WHO WATCHES THE WATCHMEN?"
How long can we keep this up?
My government contacts tell me they're pushing some new bill through Congress. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
Until then, we're society's only protection.
Protection from what? Blake laughs, exultant in the blowing smoke, the chaos.
Are you kidding? From themselves. CLOSE ON: the happy face pin on Blake's costume. MATCH CU
--Dan fingering Blake's happy face pin.

Lord have mercy upon us. Amen. Dan DROPS the pin into Blake's grave. The mourners linger moment as dirt is shoveled onto Blake's casket, then star filing out. We follow one particular mourner all the way the back--a LONE MAN, as he walks away.
The Lone Man leaves quickly.
The Lone Man removes his hat and coat. He is old, withere He is EDGAR JACOBI. In his younger days, he was a supervillain known as MOLOCH--we recognize him from the n clipping in Blake's closet.

Moloch goes to the REFRIGERATOR, opens it. Then stops, staring. There is a scrawled NOTE inside. Moloch picks it in spiky handwriting it reads: "LOOK BEHIND YOU." Over Moloch's shoulder Rorschach's hat-brim TILTS UP. As Moloch turns, Rorschach lunges, PINS Moloch's ARM behind back and SLAMS him to the floor.
Edgar William Jacobi. Also known as Edgar William Vaughn. Also known as William Edgar Bright. Also known as Moloch.
What are you talking about? I'm a retired business maaAAAHHH! (CONTINUED)
Rorschach TWISTS the man's arm back viciously.
Lie again, I'll break your arm.
Oh God, please. I did my time. I'm not Moloch anymore. What do you want from me? Rorschach lets him go. Moloch's hollow eyes follow him.
You attended a funeral today. Why?
The funeral? I don't know why I went. I just felt I should. I'd been thinking about the Comedian-- Rorschach SLAMS Moloch against the wall.
How did you know Blake was the Comedian?
He broke in here! A week ago! He, he had his mask off. He was drunk--
You were enemies for forty years. Why would he visit you?
I don't know! I woke up in my bedroom and there he was! He was upset! Crying!
The Comedian? Crying?
He, he was babbling, not making sense. I was pissing in my pants--I thought he was going to kill me!
What did he say?!
He said he was wrong. About it all being a joke, that it wasn't funny anymore. He said he was scared-- (CONTINUED)
Scared of what?!

Something he saw, I think. He said something about wishing he never broke into that building. But that he had to keep his mouth shut. Then, then he left! Rorschach studies Moloch a moment, then releases him.

Hm. Funny story. Sounds unbelievable. Probably true. Rorschach glances around the kitchen. He opens some drawe looking inside. He picks up a stack of MAIL, flips throug it. One of the envelopes contains a PENSION CHECK from "Pyramid Industries."
So that's it? I'm clean?
Clean? I searched your house. Found illegal drugs.
Illegal--I don't use drugs. Rorschach pulls a PILL BOTTLE from his coat.
Laetril. Phony medication made from apricot pits. Illegal.
oh c-come on. Look, please don't confiscate that. I'm trying anything . I have cancer.
What kind of cancer?
The kind you don't get better from.
Fine. You're off the hook, for now. If you remember anything else, leave me a note in the trash can opposite the Gunga Diner at Fortieth and Seventh. Keep out of trouble, Moloch. 36.
CLOSE ON: Rorschach blasting through the night air as the city streams by. This close, he appears to be flying.

Rorschach's Journal, October 17th. Thought about Moloch's story on my way to the cemetery. Could all be lies. A scheme for revenge planned during his years behind bars. CUT WIDE: To reveal he is actually PERCHED ATOP AN ELEVAT SUBWAY CAR. Just one way he gets around.
But if it's true, then what? What could have possibly scared the Comedian? What building was he talking about? What was it that he saw? So many questions.
Rorschach stands alone over Blake's fresh grave. Paying h proper respects.
Edward Blake--the Comedian. Born 1944, buried in the rain. Murdered. FLASH TO: Blake, the night of his murder, turning as his is kicked in.
Violent lives ending violently. FLASH TO: Adrian's display burning.
Blake understood. Humans are violent in nature. No matter how much you try to dress it up, to disguise it. FLASHES OF: The group photo of the old Watchmen. Then the photo of the new Watchmen.
Blake saw the true face of human kind and chose to become a parody of it, treated it like a joke. FLASHES OF: Blake being beaten in his apartment. (CONTINUED)
I heard a joke once. Man goes to a doctor, says he's depressed. Life seems harsh and cruel. Blake is KICKED in the stomach.
Says he feels all alone in a threatening world. Blake stands alone in the blowing tear gas smoke.
Doctor says, "the treatment is simple. The great clown Pagliacci is in town tonight. Go and see him. That should pick you up." Blake is lifted up by the Intruder's hands.
The man bursts into tears. A bloodied Blake laughs at the Intruder.
"But doctor," he says. ULTRA-SLOW, Blake crashes through his apartment window.
"I am Pagliacci." Blake FLIES TOWARD FRAME on his silent trip to the ground
Good joke. Everybody laugh. Blake FALLS INTO FRAME--GO BLACK .
CLOSE ON: Laurie, eyes closed with pleasure, as Dr. Manhattan's GLOWING BLUE HANDS caress her face.
Mmm. What time do you have to be at your TV interview?
Don't worry, we have plenty of time. (CONTINUED)
Eyes still closed, she does not see a THIRD BLUE HAND tra line down her cheek. She kisses it.
Hey, your finger, it's like licking a battery. It's all-- She opens her eyes. They widen in shock and horror as she sees TWO DR. MANHATTANS in bed with her.
Oh God! That's horrible! Stop it! Laurie jumps up. The two Dr. Manhattans stand, confused.
Please don't be upset. I thought you'd enjoy it.
I'm sorry, I--You startled me, that's all
I don't know what stimulates you anymore. Laurie backs into the hall, trying to get a grip.
Forget about it. I overreacted. It was just strange to see-- Laurie can now see into the KITCHEN, where yet a THIRD DR MANHATTAN is working on an experiment. Her eyes blaze.
How long have you been working in here?
Laurie, try to understand--
Understand!? You're working in here at the same time we're in bed!?
My work with Adrian is at an important stage. It seemed unnecessary to--
Shut up! Just SHUT YOUR MOUTH! Laurie WHIPS a full BEAKER at 3's chest. It PASSES THROUG HIM and SMASHES IN THE KITCHEN SINK. Laurie storms out. (CONTINUED)

Laurie, please--If you think there's a problem with my attitude, I'm prepared to discuss it-- As he speaks, the smashed BEAKER and its contents RISE IN THE AIR, REASSEMBLING perfectly in the palm of 3's hand. IN THE HALL: Laurie nearly bumps into Dr. Manhattan 2.
--but logically, not clouded with human emotion.
Human emotion? You were human once. That's the problem, Jon. You've forgotten that.

Laurie, where are you-- The door slams. Laurie's left. For good. Dr. Manhattan 2 stands there. He walks back to the BEDROO where 1 is. Dr. Manhattan 1 holds an OLD PHOTO. In the ph is a COUPLE, smiling into the camera. We recognize the wo as Janey Slater, Dr. Manhattan's ex-girlfriend, who we sa Adrian's flashback at Blake's funeral. We recognize the m in the photo as . Dr. Manhattan. When he was human. Dr. Manhattan stares at the photo. Perhaps feeling the ti of human emotion again
Dan heats up some leftover Chinese food in the microwave the TV plays in the B/G:

--no one's fired their weapons yet, but no one's lowered them either. Maybe these other countries aren't so afraid of Dr. Manhattan, maybe they're calling the President's bluff. I'm very curious to see what Dr. Manhattan himself has to say in his live interview which should be in about an hour or so BOOM, BOOM! Dan looks up. Someone's banging on the door. Hard. 40.
Dan approaches the door, cautious, mask killer on his min
Who is it?
It's Laurie.
Laurie? It takes a few moments for him to open the door.
Sorry, I had a new lock installed, it's a little sticky--
I left Jon.
Dan pours a teary eyed Laurie a glass of RED WINE.
Did, uh, the Secret Service follow you here?
I lost them in the subways. I think.
I'm really sorry, Laurie.
Living with him . Dan, you don't know what it's been like. INTERCUT TO: Dr. Manhattan, holding Laurie's BRA. Staring

The way he looks at things, like he can't remember what they are, like he doesn't really care. This world, the real world to him it's like walking through mist, and all the people are just shadows. Shadows in the fog. Dr. Manhattan lowers his head. A SHADOW FALLS OVER HIM. H looks up to see a THREE PIECE SUIT floating before him-- waiting for its wearer. 41.
Dan and Laurie walk the streets, getting some air.
I hope I didn't ruin your night.

Not at all. I was just going to see Hollis for our weekly beer session. You're more than welcome to join. In fact, I insist They pass the news stand from the opening scene. The Home Man is arguing with the News Vendor:

--I told you, this month's issue still hasn't arrived yet! Why do you care about that right wing rag so much? Cuz those bastards don't give a damn about you, pal! They--hold up, here it comes. They turn as SEYMOUR, a fat slob of a man, arrives with a BUNDLE of the latest issue of "The New Frontiersman." CUT TO: Dr. Manhattan stepping THROUGH and INTO the empty floating suit. His TIE knots itself. Dr. Manhattan looks around the empty room . sad? Again, he looks at the photo of him and Janey Slater . . then DISAPPEARS IN A BURST OF PARTICLES.
Dan and Laurie turn down a darker, less populated street.
Laurie, will you please stop apologizing? I'm here for you anytime. SHADOWS trail behind them, ominous. Someone's following.
I know. I just find it rude when people show up at your door--
The main waiting area. People go about their jobs. The RECEPTIONIST hears a strange, electric CRACKLING (CONTINUED)
--completely out of the blue. Suddenly, Dr. Manhattan appears in a burst of energy. The receptionist SHRIEKS. The PRODUCER looks out his office.
Terrific. Dr. Manhattan arrives and no one thinks to tell me?
He, he just--
All geez. We don't have time for make-up. That blue is too light for television. The light from Dr. Manhattan's SKIN DARKENS to a DEEPER B
Is this dark enough?
Uh, yeah
Dan and Laurie turn down an alley. We now see who's follo them--a group of YOUNG THUGS.
that's dark enough.
A White House PRESS AGENT escorts Dr. Manhattan to the se

Just another reminder that if the second Geneva Convention comes up, our official position is that talks will not resume until the Chinese agree to exclude you from the agenda. The President approved this interview because he wanted to strengthen morale at home and to gently remind the rest of the world who holds the cards. Please keep that in mind. Dr. Manhattan stands off stage, waiting. The LIGHTS come and we're live with the glossy NEWS HOST. (CONTINUED)

He's been called many things; Hero, weapon, linchpin of our security-- CUT TO: Dan and Laurie turning as the Young Thugs BLOCK T ALLEYWAY. One of the Thugs pulls a KNIFE. Laurie and Dan exchange a look. Dan removes his glasses. CUT BACK TO:

His given name is Jonathan Osterman--Dr. Jonathan Osterman--a renowned nuclear physicist who through a terrible accident became the man the world knows today as Dr. Manhattan. The audience APPLAUDS loudly as Dr. Manhattan takes his s
Thank you.

Thank you, Dr. Manhattan, and not simply for appearing on this program. I believe I speak for all of America when I thank you for thwarting the terrorist plot at the port of Long Beach over a week ago-- Furious applause from the audience, which Dr. Manhattan regards curiously.

It was my duty. CUT TO: Dan and Laurie surrounded by the Thugs . when suddenly they DIVE INTO the group, fighting like the hero they once were. Dan grapples with one of the Thugs and knocks his knife a --when another Thug nails him from behind with a BAT. Dan drops to the ground . BACK TO:

Before we start, I want to explain to our viewers the unconventional format for this interview. Our live audience is made up entirely of news media and Dr. Manhattan will be taking questions from the floor. This commercial free broadcast is presented to you by Veidt Enterprises. We see Adrian standing near the audience with the Press Agent, smiling for the camera. (CONTINUED)
CUT TO: Laurie, driving a FIST into a Thug's NOSE, when another Thug GRABS HER HAIR.

We will now take our first question-- The Thug draws a PISTOL on her. Dan, still on the ground, sees the gun and his eyes narrow, harden. He pushes himse up off the ground. CUT BACK TO: The TV Studio AUDIENCE: where Doug Roth, the journalist who interviewed Adrian earlier, stands.
Dr. Manhattan, Doug Roth, Nova Times. Do you remember a man named Wally Weaver?
Yes, he was a good friend of mine. When we were both physicists.
He died of cancer.
I remember. I attended his funeral.

How about Edgar Jacobi, also known as the supervillian Moloch? You had a lot of battles with him, didn't you? Did you know that he has cancer as-well? The News Host looks confused. Adrian turns to the Press Agent, growing concerned with where this is leading. CUT TO: Dan, snapping the GUNMAN'S wrist back and up-- Barrel aimed at the Thug's CHIN. In the last fraction of second, Dan SHIFTS the gun two inches left as it FIRES, deafening the Thug, but leaving him alive. BACK TO:
I was not aware--
And what about Jose Flores? He was the longtime janitor at the Watchmen Headquarters where you worked for many years. Cancer. (CONTINUED)
By your line of questioning, you're suggesting that I was the cause of cancer in these individuals.
You tell me, doc. Adrian turns to him.
Doug, that `s enough.
It is irrelevant whether I was the cause or not.
Irrelevant?
A live human body and a dead human body have the same number of particles. Structurally there's no difference. An appalled then angry buzz comes over the audience.
What about Janey Slater? Do you think it makes a difference to her?
Janey Slater? Wh--

Your ex-girlfriend, she was a physicist too. You were with her for ten years. Or does she have to remind you herself? Suddenly Janey Slater emerges from a door at the top of t stands. She is old now, frail, barely recognizable from t images we've see of her.
She has cancer as well. Doctors have given her six months. What do you have to say, Ms. Slater? He sticks the microphone in her face.
D-damn you, Jon. God damn you (CONTINUED)
She leaves as fast as she came, bursting into tears. Dr. Manhattan stands, visibly shaken--
No, Janey, wait! In the audience, Adrian turns to the Press Agent, frantic
We need to stop this now. Adrian and the Press Agent hurry on stage, SECURITY following.

That's it! Interview's over! BACK TO: The alley, littered with the unconscious BODIES the Thugs. Laurie and Dan lean back on the wall, gasping air, horribly out of shape, but victorious. CUT TO: The TV studio, as Adrian and Security surround Dr Manhattan, trying to escort him out. The audience spills of the stands, RUSHING Dr. Manhattan with questions and, FLASHING cameras--it's madness. Adrian shoves a camera ou Dr. Manhattan's face.
As the sponsor of this program I demand all cameras off! His plea is futile, of course. A REPORTER breaks through, gets in Dr. Manhattan's face.
Did you give Ms. Slater cancer by sleeping with her?
No. Please let me through
Do you even care about human life?
Please. If everyone would just go away and leave me alone. Adrian hears the note of warning in his voice. (CONTINUED)
Everyone back off! Don't you understand? He's the only thing preventing the world from chaos!
How many other people did you do this to? Dr. Manhattan finally SNAPS--
I said LEAVE ME ALONE! Every last person BURSTS INTO PARTICLES and DISAPPEARS. D Manhattan is suddenly alone. He looks stunned almost.
The TV audience materializes out on the roof
Dan and Laurie exit the quiet alley, trying to play it of
I should find a hotel. God. Imagine, us getting mugged.
Why don't you come by Hollis' with me? Shake off the adrenaline.
No thanks, I've had enough hero stuff for one night. (walking away) You take care, Dan. It's a dangerous world out there.
Hollis opens the door for Dan--
You're late.
I know, you won't believe it--
You missed it--Dr. Manhattan just lost it on live TV. (CONTINUED)
Wait, what? Dan turns to the TV, which replays the clip of Dr. Manhat being accosted and then teleporting everyone to the roof.
I was just with Laurie. She doesn't know.
She'll know soon enough. The whole world will know.
Laurie rides in back, staring out at the street, calming down. The cab stops at a red light; The CABBIE takes outa ZIPPO,lights a cigarette. Laurie stares at the FLAME
like she stares at the flame here, as Adrian's display burns. Laurie glances around as everyone leaves, apologiz to Adrian.
Outside Watchmen HQ, Dan's Owl Ship rises out of view. Rorschach skulks off into the shadows. Dr. Manhattan and Janey Slater get into a Town Car as young Laurie watches around the corner.
Laurel? Laurel Jane? Startled, Laurie turns. Blake steps out of the shadows.
You're Sally Jupiter's kid.
You're the Comedian, right? You were pretty cool in there. Blake lights a smoke, looks her over.
You got your mom's eyes. Even that funny little mole.
Got another smoke? (CONTINUED)
She was one of the all-time champion beauties, your mom. She talk about me much?
No. Not really. As Blake gives her a light, Laurie touches his hand to co the lighter from the wind. She looks up at him, sly.
Laurie nearly jumps out of her skin. A younger Sally marc toward them from a LIMO, waiting at the sidewalk.
Hey Doll. Long time no see.
Not long enough in my book, Eddie. She eyes Laurie with cool death.
Put that out. Get in the car. INSIDE THE LIMO: Laurie cracks her window an inch. Her mother's harsh, low tone drifts clearly back.
Are there no depths you won't sink to?
Christ, we were just talking! Can't a guy talk to his, y'know, friend's daughter? What the hell do you think I am?
I know what you are, Eddie. I've always known. Don't ever forget that. Driving off, Laurie watches Blake through the window--
--like she watches through the window in the present. The light turns green-- --when a BLACK SUV pulls in front of the cab, BLOCKING it path. (CONTINUED)
The Cabbie honks his horn as a team of SECRET SERVICE AGE get out of the SUV. Agent Forbes knocks on Laurie's windo
Ms. Jupiter, you need to come with us now.
Agent Forbes escorts her into the room.
I don't understand, what do you mean, Jon's gone?

I mean he snapped and disappeared during the interview. Now our trackers can't detect him anywhere on the planet. If we want to find him you're our only hope. A TECHNICIAN wires Laurie up; GRAPHS record Laurie's neur responses, MONITORS show satellite images.
Miss Jupiter, we need you to visualize Dr. Manhattan. Do you need a prompt?
No.
Neurotransmissions tracking.
Transmitting on all frequencies.
We're ready Miss Jupiter. We need you to try and talk to him. Laurie, wired like a porcupine, seems embarrassed.

Jon? Jon, can you hear me? The GRAPH-NEEDLES jump and tick, searching . when a high, clear TONE rings through the room. Needles fly. Technicians dash to lock it down. Agent Forb hurries to the graph, looking over their shoulders.
Have you got him? (CONTINUED)
We've located his signal, yes.
Well? Where the hell is he? The Technician looks up, not happy about the answer.
He's on Mars.
HUGE DISHES scan the skies. We hear the high, clear tone, above all the RADIO CHATTER, NEWS REPORTS and MILITARY FREQUENCIES, the endless, echoing chaff of the world...
--massive mobilization of troops in
--unconfirmed reports of a gunfire exchange in Tehran--
--prompting the President to call an emergency meeting with his National Security Advisors--
Jon. Can you hear me, Jon? But these VOICES get progressively QUIETER, as we-- ZOOM BACK: Up, out of the atmosphere, at a blinding rate-

--landing on A VAST MARTIAN PLAIN, and the tiny BLUE FIGU walking across it, RED DUST BILLOWING behind him. The pea and quiet after the cacophony of Earth is soothing. Dr. Manhattan stops, looking over the landscape. He holds photo of him and Janey Slater in his hand, when he was hu He stares at the photo a moment and closes his eyes-- --and we FLASHBACK to the moment that photo was taken. He Janey are at a CARNIVAL. After the flash, Janey turns to
Aww, Jon, look--you've got cotton candy on the side of your mouth (CONTINUED)

You do too. Here, let me get it for you. He pulls her close. They giggle like the young lovers the are and then kiss, passionate BACK TO: Dr. Manhattan walking on mars' surface. He approaches a LARGE ROCK FORMATION which blocks his path. He PARTS the rock formation telekinetically, like Moses parting the sea-- --and we FLASHBACK, mirroring the parting of the rock formation to the parting of two SLIDING DOORS, in the LAB A NUCLEAR TESTING FACILITY, as Jon steps into the REACTOR
(YELLING)

I'll catch up with you guys--I left my watch inside . Jon backs into the chamber without noticing the DIGITAL C above the doors counting down: 3 2 1--"TIME LOCK INITIATED"--the doors CLOSE . BACK TO: Dr. Manhattan on Mars as he stops to pick up a STRANGE ROCK. It's beautiful--the colors, the crystals-- unlike anything we've ever seen-- --and we FLASHBACK to Jon's lab COLLEAGUES watching in ho as Jon retrieves his WATCH, oblivious. They try to open t door, but it's no use--the time lock can't be overridden. Janey arrives, SCREAMS when she sees Jon inside. Jon turn sees all the terrified faces staring at him.
Janey? What's wrong?
The time lock, Jon! As it dawns on Jon, he hears the hum of the REACTOR INITIATING, the big mechanical parts moving. Jon runs to door, BANGS on it.
Janey: Oh my god! TEARS stream down Janey's face as she looks at him throug the thick glass, helpless, hopeless. Inside, the chamber starts to GLOW . (CONTINUED)
I'm sorry, Jon, I can't-- Janey can't bear to watch--she runs out of the lab as the reactor initiates

. and with a BLINDING FLASH--Jon and his watch are OBLITERATED to bits . BACK TO: Dr. Manhattan on Mars, as he obliterates the str rock he was holding to bits and we FLASHBACK to the lab CAFETERIA. Janey sits at a table, crying softly, being consoled by her colleagues CUT TO: OUTSIDE THE NUCLEAR FACILITY, by the barbed wire fences, A DISEMBODIED BRAIN, A SET OF EYES, AND A SPINAL COLUMN MATERIALIZES . BACK TO: Dr. Manhattan on Mars, as he RISES into the air. a thought, the RED SAND FUSES into a beautiful, PINK GLAS

--and we FLASHBACK to the cafeteria KITCHEN as a COOK SHR at A WALKING NETWORK OF HUMAN VEINS-- BACK TO: The pink glass structure on Mars which SPREADS O INTO COMPLEX GLASS PATTERNS, RISING FROM THE PLAIN at Dr. Manhattan's command-- --and we FLASHBACK to the cafeteria HALLWAY as a SKELETON passes two terrified GUARDS BACK TO: Dr. Manhattan, now dwarfed by the RISING, EVOLVI GLASS STRUCTURE, which begins to resemble parts of a WATC --and we FLASHBACK to the cafeteria. Janey's still crying One of her Colleagues reaches for her hand when STATIC SP snap around them. All over the cafeteria, the METAL UTENS begin to SPARK. In the center of the room, GLOWING BLUE PARTICLES begin to collect, SLAMMING INTO EACH OTHER with amazing force and in a BLINDING FLASH, THE PARTICLES FORM DR. MANHATTAN, hovering over the room like a newborn god. Everyone in the cafeteria looks up in awe, in fear and--
Oh god . Jon is that you? (CONTINUED)
--recognition. BACK TO: Mars, where Dr. Manhattan's GLASS PALACE rises i its full glory. A home fit for a god.
PULL OUT FROM: A SATELLITE IMAGE of MARS. NOISE filters b in, as TECHNICIANS buzz this way and that, desperate.
There must be some way to contact him. Laurie sits in the room, largely forgotten.
Agent Forbes.
(distracted, annoyed) What?
I need to go to the bathroom. Agent Forbes gives her a look, then waves for a SECRET SERVICE AGENT to escort her.

Laurie heads to the bathroom, trailed by the Secret Servi Agent. As she reaches the bathroom door-- --she suddenly SPINS and ELBOWS the agent in the GROIN. T Agent buckles; Laurie grabs him by his coat, SHOVES his h through the bathroom door and SLAMS THE DOOR on his head.
Laurie drags the groggy Agent into the bathroom. She take his GUN, pulls it on him.
You're getting me out of here.
We're only detaining you for national security purposes. Don't you understand?
Don't you understand that sitting there with a bunch of high tech radios and monitors isn't going to bring him back? (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Only one thing can bring ion back and that's Jon. If he wants to find me, he's quite capable of doing so on his own. I've been a prisoner in my live long enough. You are taking me out of here because if you don't, and Jon does come back, I'm going to let him know who was naughty and who was nice. And he won't give you a lump of coal--he'll turn you into one, understand? The Agent eyes her, then reluctantly gets to his feet.
Dan sleeps peacefully in his bed when a SHADOW moves over . dropping a NEWSPAPER on his LAP, waking Dan with a gasp. Rorschach hovers beside the bed.
Jesus! Rorschach
Good morning, Daniel. I brought in your paper. Dan reads the headline: "DR. MANHATTAN LEAVES EARTH."
The Comedian murdered. Dr. Manhattan exiled. Two of us gone within a week. Who's next? Veidt? Ms. Jupiter? Me? You? Rorschach turns for the door as Dan reads the story.
By the way, that new lock broke after one shove.
My new lock?
Get a stronger one, Daniel. You can't be too security conscious these days.
These days nobody's safe. We see the same Pakistani Soldiers from before, only now there are dozens more TROOPS with them, mobilizing on the border as are their Indian counterparts-- (CONTINUED)
CUT TO: The Chinese Battleships we saw before, moving tow the coast of Taiwan. They FIRE SHOTS-- CUT TO: The Israel Missile Control room we were in before bustles with frantic action.
--three synagogues were bombed in Tel Aviv, a bus exploded in Jerusalem--
Enough! (BEAT)
Begin the first wave of air strikes.
A HUGE MAP OF THE WORLD is projected onto the war-room screens. The President and his ADVISORS look up at it.
The Chinese have already made their move. India and Pakistan have engaged and everyone in the Middle East is going at Israel. Time to start picking sides, Mr. President.
Forget picking sides--first, are we safe?
We've increased security at all entry points: water ports, airports and border patrol.
I want the National Guard put on the border. As for the rest of it . let's not jump into the fray just yet.
Mr. President, I urge you to--
Let's just wait, okay?! Maybe he'll come back. (beat, wishful) Maybe he'll come back.
Adrian steps off the elevator when he's met by his Assist (CONTINUED)
Clock's ticking, Mr. Veidt.
I know. I'm meeting the toy people, yes?
Eleven-thirty. They want to talk to you about some new villains for the "Ozymandias" line.
All the old villains are dead.
What's with everybody today? Everyone's on this death trip.
I suppose the threat of war has that effect. ACROSS THE WAY, Dan enters the building, intercepts Adria
Adrian, I need to talk to you. Adrian looks put off.
Dan, I'm sorry, this is a bad time.
But what about what happened with ion? Adrian excuses himself from his Assistant.
Jon's departure is terrible. Not only for what's happening in the world now, but for what could have happened. The energy project he and I were working on--it's dead now .
Rorschach came to see me again. Maybe there's something to this mask killer thing.
Are you still preoccupied with the ramblings of that lunatic? I really don't have time for this, Dan. (CONTINUED)
Adrian walks away, continuing on with his Assistant when a MAN in a TRENCHCOAT approaches the pair. He DRAWS GUN on them .
Sometimes I can't bear to watch the news. It makes it so hard to be optimistic Is that a gun? Dan sees what's happening--

Adrian! BANG! The man SHOOTS the Assistant in the gut; Adrian immediately springs into action--he moves with unbelievab speed and quickness, grabbing a velvet ROPE-STANCHION-- --DEFLECTING A SECOND BULLET with it-- --and SMASHING IT INTO THE FACE OF THE ASSASSIN, knocking into a FOUNTAIN. SECURITY GUARDS run, guns drawn, toward the fountain wher Adrian GRAPPLES with the dazed man.
Mr. Veidt! Let us handle it!
Wait, he's got a poison capsule! He JAMS his fingers into the Assassin's mouth when Dan arrives.
Don't bite down, you scum! I want to know who sent you! The Assassin's eyes BULGE
I want to know who's behind this! The Assassin CHOKES and dies. Adrian DROPS him, unanswered. He looks over at Dan, frustrated.
Dan and Laurie sit in the back of the cafe, making sure t have privacy. (CONTINUED)
Oh my god. Where's Adrian now?

Talking to the cops. Thank god he's still in great shape. You get so caught up with the whole smartest man in the world thing you forget what a physical specimen he is- -he's as fast as I've ever seen him (BEAT)
What about you? What are you going to do?
I'm not sure. I can't go stay with my mom- -I'm sure that's the first place they'll look. But I need to get out of the city. It's only a matter of time before they find me.
Listen, why don't you . how about you stay at my place?
Oh, Dan, I couldn't impose--
It wouldn't be an imposition, I have an extra room. We're friends. And with everything that's been happening
You're buying into Rorschach's "mask killer" theory?
I don't know. But it can't hurt to be safe. Besides, I've already had one wanted person visit me, another one won't make a difference. They look at each other. Laurie smiles.
Okay. (BEAT)
So this guy who tried to kill Adrian--who was he?
Some local low-life named Roy Chess (CONTINUED)

Rorschach investigates the apartment of ROY CHESS, Adrian would-be assassin. The place is decent but messy. Rorschach spots a PORNO MAG on the coffee table. On the c nearby, a pair of PANTS. Rorschach picks them up, reaches into the pockets. He pulls out some cash, credit cards-- --and an ID for Pyramid Industries. It says Chess was a security guard . and then Rorschach remembers the pension check he saw at Moloch's house. From Pyramid Industries. Rorschach sees a LAPTOP over on the kitchen table. The computer is on and shows the SERVER for Pyramid Industrie Rorschach navigates the server until he finds the EMPLOYE DIRECTORY. Once in the directory he pauses for a second. Then he typ in a name: "Jane Slater." A photo of Janey Slater pops up--"Status: RETIRED." Rorschach stares at the screen, excited at the connection
We're in Rorschach's POV as he walks down the street. Fro the non-reaction of passers by, he obviously doesn't have mask on.

Rorschach's Journal, October 19th. Someone tried to kill Adrian Veidt. Proves mask killer theory--the murderer is closing in. Pyramid Industries is the key. Rorschach approaches a TRASH CAN. He rummages through it finds an ENVELOPE. He opens it and finds a NOTE that read "Tonight 11:30, M."
Checked mail drop, got a message from Moloch. Was just going to pay him a visit. Rorschach turns down an alley, approaches a DUMPSTER. He reaches behind the dumpster.
My things are where I left them. My coat. My gloves (CONTINUED)
Still in his POV, we watch him put each article on. Then pulls out his MASK.
. my face. Rorschach pulls his mask on, FILLING THE SCREEN
CLOSE ON: MOLOCH'S EYES staring fearfully out the rainy window. Rorschach APPEARS in the darkness behind him.
Somebody tried to shoot the world's smartest man today, Moloch. Moloch sits at the kitchen table. CLOSE ON: MOLOCH'S HAND ignored CIGARETTE smolders. In his other hand, a NOTE.

The hitman worked for Pyramid Industries. So did Janey Slater and everyone else Dr. Manhattan allegedly gave cancer to. And last time I was here, I saw a pension check sent to you from the same company-- obviously a front set up by whoever it is that killed the Comedian, that pushed Dr. Manhattan over the edge, that wants us masks dead. Is that why you left me a note in my mail drop? You have something to confess? Rorschach turns. A HOLE gapes between Moloch's staring ey A PISTOL lies on the table--Moloch's dead. Rorschach carefully pulls the NOTE from Moloch's hand. It the note Rorschach had left in Moloch's refrigerator, the that reads: "LOOK BEHIND YOU." Behind Rorschach, BLINDING LIGHT GLARES THROUGH THE WINDO
(over LOUDSPEAKERS)
No.
(CONTINUED)
No. No, no, no

head_text.subj: IF THERE'S ANYONE IN THERE WITH YOU, SEND

text: Moloch's corpse stares at Rorschach. Rorschach TEARS OPEN cupboards, pulling items off the shelves.
Framed. Set up. Walked right into it. Stupid, stupid, stupid.

head_text.subj: LET'S MAKE THIS A NICE, CLEAN SURRENDER.

text: Heh. Never. Never surrender. Rorschach takes an AEROSOL CAN and a PEPPER SHAKER.
Rorschach's mask DISAPPEARS back into darkness.
When you are
CRASH! Moloch's door is SMASHED OPEN. Armed SWAT COPS swa in, but no more than three can fit in the narrow entry wa
It's a bum tip, I'm telling you.

Keep your eyes open. SWAT Cop 1 moves down the hall, carelessly ahead of forma --BEHIND HIM, Rorschach APPEARS out of the darkness. He IGNITES the AEROSOL CAN'S STREAM, SPRAYING THE COPS WITH FIRE. They fall back, screaming, shooting. SWAT Cop 1 cat the worst of it--he DROPS AND ROLLS on the floor, trying extinguish the flames on him. Rorschach BOLTS upstairs, IGNITING the staircase behind h Pandemonium. (CONTINUED)
Where'd he go?
Upstairs! He's upstairs! Go!
SWAT COPS top the 2nd floor landing, already lit by fire.
Where is he?! (into radio) Send the second team in! Graves is down! And we need a fire unit. All this smoke--
Stay calm, the file says he never goes armed. Rorschach APPEARS, blowing PEPPER INTO COP 2'S EYES.
Get out of the way! I don't have room to-- SWAT Cop 3 CLEARS his line of fire and finds Rorschach AIMING THE GRAPPLING GUN AT HIS CHEST .
The HOOK BLOWS THE BODY-ARMORED COP OVER THE RAILING.
Det. Gallagher and Fine watch from behind a LINE OF COP C The house is now BLAZING. Smoke and men's screams drift o

We've got him. There's no way out. From the second floor, Rorschach SMASHES THROUGH THE WIND snarling like a rabid dog, landing hard on the concrete. ankle TWISTS, dropping him to the ground. Rorschach struggles to get to his feet. When he looks up finds TWENTY COPS IN A SEMI-CIRCLE before him. A loaded, pregnant pause. The COPS RUSH FORWARD. (CONTINUED)
But Rorschach holds up a gloved hand. And they all stop, unsure what this lunatic will do next.
Ten years. I've waited for this. He beckons them forward. The cops PILE INTO HIM. Rorschac brutally disables six cops before he is overwhelmed.
No pain. Must get up. Find who framed me-- A Cop KICKS HIM in the throat. Rorschach drops again.
Get that mask off him!
I got it. Christ, he stinks!
No no no NO NO NO! The Cop peels back the shifting mask to reveal the Homele Man from the news stand. He screams at them wildly.
My face! Give it back to me! Rorschach is finally beaten, surrounded by cops, as Moloc house blazes in the background.
Dan is at the front door, fixing the lock Rorschach buste twice, when Laurie comes down the stairs, yawning.
What time is it?
Noon. Thought I'd let you sleep in. Laurie smiles at him. Is Dan crazy or does he sense a spa She touches his shoulder as she turns into the living roo then turns on the TV: (CONTINUED)

Today, police searched the apartment of Walter Kovacs, better known as the masked vigilante Rorschach. Kovacs was captured last night and charged with the murder of Edgar Jacobi, formerly known as the supervillain Moloch. Moloch was found shot in the head at point blank range. Both Dan and Laurie stop what they're doing, eyes fixed o the TV: They see Rorschach, unmasked, IN SHACKLES.

Inside the decrepit apartment, police discovered stacks of right-wing literature, including several years of back issues of the ultra-conservative publication, "The New Frontiersman." We asked "New Frontiersman" editor, Hector Godfrey, for comment. CUT TO: A clip of the EDITOR being interviewed. We see Seymour, who we met at the news stand, in the background.
Rorschach is an American patriot and we are proud that he reads this publication.
During his capture, Kovacs assaulted and severely injured at least nine police officers, shooting one officer with a grappling gun. That officer is in serious but stable condition.

Meanwhile, in Kashmir, fighting continues to intensify. Both India and Pakistan alluded that the use of nuclear weapons is not out of the question-- Laurie shuts off the TV, not wanting to hear the war talk
That mask's eaten Rorschach's brains away.
He wasn't always like that. We were a great team--tactically, he was brilliant. But I don't know, something about this murder charge I just can't see Rorschach shooting Moloch. (CONTINUED)
He shot a cop with a grappling gun.
Don't remind me, I made that thing for him. But a regular gun just seems too . ordinary
And this war, god. Sometimes I wish I could just leave the planet. Like Jon.
Oh sure. The old Manhattan Transfer.
Now, that's funny. That's what you call Jon's teleportation?
Well, not to his face. Laurie laughs.
Rorschach walks, led by TWO CORRECTIONAL OFFICERS. From t cells, PRISONERS shout insults, death threats. Rorschach stares ahead. Silent. Calm.
The PRISON PSYCHIATRIST, Black, amiable, a mite portly, s across the table from Rorschach sans mask: Cold and frightening. The Psychiatrist reads his FILE.
Walter Kovacs. Is that your name? Walter?
No. The Psychiatrist sits back, considering Rorschach careful

Let me explain your situation here, Walter. If you cooperate with me, I may be able to convince them that you should to be treated medically, in a hospital, which I believe is best for you. But the authorities want to put you in General Population. (CONTINUED)
A prison is a prison.
Yes, but the difference is, downstairs? They'll eat you alive. He holds up a RORSCHACH BLOT-CARD.
Now . . tell me what you see. FLASH OF: A DEAD DOG. Bloody, horrible.
A pretty butterfly. The Psychiatrist holds up another blot-card.

How about this one? What do you see here? FLASH OF: Rorschach, as a LITTLE BOY, watching his MOTHER HALF NAKED, EMBRACE A MAN AS HE HANDS HER SOME MONEY. Whe she catches Rorschach interrupting, she SMACKS him in the face. Shuts the door on him.

Some nice flowers. The Psychiatrist eyes him, dubious. Holds up another card FLASH OF: Rorschach as a little boy looking up at TWO OLD BOYS, teasing him. Calling him "son of a whore." Rorschac just wants to be left alone when one of the Boys SPITS in face. Suddenly, Rorschach's face changes. He attacks the like a wild animal--biting, clawing .
Clouds. The Psychiatrist sighs, puts the cards down.
Tell me about Rorschach. Will you do that?
Why are you here with me, doctor?
Because I want to make you well. (CONTINUED)
There's other men in here with behavior more extreme than mine. Of course, they're not famous. You want to know about Rorschach, doctor? I'll tell you about Rorschach
Rorschach, walks through intermittent STREETLIGHTS. In hi GLOVE, he holds a PHOTO of an angelic SIX YEAR OLD GIRL.
I was investigating a kidnap case. Blair Roche, 6 year old girl. I was young then. Too soft on criminals. I let them live.
A creepy, deserted-looking house. Rorschach peers through slatted fence at TWO GERMAN SHEPHERDS FIGHTING.
Broke a man's arm to get a tip. Led me to the missing girl's location.

CRACK! The front door is KICKED OPEN, smashing the lock. Rorschach moves between a line of headless MANNEQUINS. In corner rests an old WOOD-BURNING STOVE. Rorschach peers inside, removes a BLACKENED scrap of UNDERWEAR. It's decorated with little hearts and bears.
I knew the girl was here. But when I searched the place I found nothing.

Rorschach enters the kitchen. Out the window, the DOGS ar fighting. Rorschach opens a cupboard, where a line of KNI CLEAVERS and a HACKSAW hang on hooks. Outside, the snarli dogs get LOUDER. Slowly now, Rorschach's gaze moves from the knives . to the counter. He runs his gloved finger along RED STAINED, DEEP-CUT GROOVES in a THICK WOODEN CHOPPING BLOCK. Blood. gaze continues out the window
And then I found her. (CONTINUED)

. to the dogs, still fighting over the BONE, which we now recognize as a small, HUMAN FEMUR--that of the little gir Rorschach clenches his hands in fury, his fists tremble and suddenly, he relaxes. Calms. Rorschach slowly turns to the cupboard. He reaches for a large CLEAVER .
The CHILD MOLESTER, greasy and fat, walks past the now-si fence.
It was dark when the murderer got back. As dark as it gets.
The Man flicks a LIGHT SWITCH. Nothing. He draws a GUN.

He tries the light in here. Nothing again. He turns away the BODY of a DEAD GERMAN SHEPARD CRASHES THROUGH THE WIN He SCRAMBLES through the warehouse, falling over mannequi He FIRES madly into the dark. The SECOND DOG SMASHES INTO FROM A SECOND WINDOW. His gun goes flying. He scrambles backward against the stove. FROM BEHIND, Rorschach CUFFS THE MAN'S WRIST TO THE STOVE When the Child Molester sees that "face," he loses his bladder. Rorschach just stares, mask-blots shifting
You think I had something to do with that girl? I didn't! Where's your evidence? Rorschach calmly points to body of the dog. (It is the same image Rorschach saw in the first blot-card.)
Okay, I confess! I kidnapped her! I killed her! Arrest me!
Men get arrested. Rorschach RAISES THE CLEAVER, high over his head (CONTINUED)
